As far as I know, this problem was reproducable since 3.2.4, whose actually is trival since it will be only thrown exception when fetching version descriptions.

However, when the user needs to upgrade broker version , it has a great impact when managing rocketmq in the console, which may result in the cluster page not able to render, since the cluster page needs to show the version descriptions.

So maybe we should process this pr as a hotfix so that it can be merged faster to help user to solve this problem?

Cool enhancement for this. 

But just one thing to confirm, actually rocketmq will delete commit log when the disk space is ready to be full(85% by default) even though the commit log file is not expired,  won't it @lizhanhui
@Jaskey   yeah, it's true that rocketmq will delete commit logs  when disk is full, even though not expired.
@Jaskey @vsair No, Broker only deletes expired files.
As this PR is pretty trivial, I'll merge it soon.
Merged.
Merged as this is really trivial.
@vongosling @shroman any idea on this PR?

> But I don't quite understand why it has to have so many levels -- why not to remove rmqAddressServerDomain and let the user use only rocketmq.namesrv.domain ... ?

Yes, I am also considering centralizing default values to an external config-default.conf file and expose config.conf for user to override. This is best conducted in a dedicated PR after discussion.
For this PR, let's fix the logical fault first.
Merged.
Guys, any idea on this PR?

Actually missing message can not be avoided when the diffrerent tags are subscribed in the same consumer groups, no matter broker refreshes the subscription data.

Say for two queues q1 q2, two consumers c1 c2.
c1->TAG1
c2->TAGB

when allocating, c1->q1, c2->q2 100 messages are sent to this topic with TAG1.

C2 will recive nothing and c1 will recieve 50 messages. but the consumer offset of q2 is till moving on. Then 50 messages are missing.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/11085446/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/11085446)

This PR does't break the restrict that all consumers should have the same subscription. It only focus on broker should hold the online consumer's subscription. Miss messages is just one result caused by inconsistency subscriptions.

@vsair 
What I mean is that the scene this pr is going to fix is breaking the restrict that the same consumer group has the same subscriptions.

Though this may help improve the refresh the subscriptions, but the same problem is still there remains  no solution in the existing design.

IMO, we should solve this problem directly to solve all the related problem. Which is issued in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ROCKETMQ-94
LGTM +1
@Jaskey This PR has been merged

Yeah, you're right. There is no way to solve the problem in existing design.
But the result is : 
when user stop the consumer has diff subscription, broker could hold the correct info.
I also look forward to the solution in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ROCKETMQ-94.
I think only servtool‘s module has guava dependency, so there is no transitive dependency pollution on sdk, right?
please @lizhanhui @shroman help to review this great PR :-)

@dongeforever @vongosling @shroman 

Thank you guys!
@vongosling   yeah, only server's modules have guava dependency, client doesn't.

When running in docker,  this would be useful.  Users just want to run a docker demo, but the computer could not allocate 8g memory, and there is no way to define the JVM flags in docker's script. OMG!
Ok, but let's set it through `JVM_OPTS` instead of introducing a variable for that specific setting.
+1 JVM_OPTS, Do not try to introducing new variable.
Or just check JAVA_OPTS have already defined Xmx
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/229551/string-contains-in-bash
+1, maybe it's better to merge JAVA_OPTS
IMO, log SendHeartBeat records of `all brokers` every 20 times is reasonable.
Merged, thanks @Jaskey , please help close this PR.
Thank you @zhouxinyu

@zhouxinyu @shroman @vongosling 
what's your advice guys?
@Jaskey Incrementing and logging heartbeats on success seems reasonable to me. All failures are logged in `catch` clause.
@lizhanhui why did we close this PR without merge?
@zhouxinyu it's been merged.
Great~

@lizhanhui ,  Do you have any other thoughts about this PR? If no, I will merge this PR soon.

And please @vsair help resolve the conflicting files.
